message.content:
cs.SE, cs.CR, cs.PL, cs.SY, cs.LG. 

The paper focuses on a software engineering problem of identifying and localizing issues in reproducible builds, which falls under the scope of cs.SE (Software Engineering). The paper also mentions the benefit of detecting attacks against build environments, which relates to cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The proposed framework RepLoc involves analyzing build logs and filtering files based on heuristics, which involves programming languages and tools, and thus relates to cs.PL (Programming Languages). The problem of reproducibility in builds also has implications for system design and control, which relates to cs.SY (Systems and Control). Finally, the use of machine learning techniques for file ranking and classification may also relate to cs.LG (Machine Learning).
